page.title: 03HOME LIFE 2 BISHOP THORNTON
page.content: A DAY IN THE LIFE OF MRS. ELSIE MOSS The post brings my Community Health Council papers to study, these include a document on Personal Health, with the problem of Drug Abuse a prominent paragraph; also a paper on Community Care for the Elderly to cope with the increasing numbers in the area. Today is the annual dinner held in the Methodist Church, cooked and provided by a Roman Catholic couple. The proceeds are to help running costs of the Church room which is used as a Community centre for the Parish. My job is to lay the tables and decorate with roses and chrysanthemums. This work took 7 hours but the dinner was a great success and an excellent slide show followed of early farming practices in the upper dale, using sepia photographs; ending with slides of flowers butterflies and animals.
